intro: Amphilophium laeve, commonly known as the smooth-leafed amphilophium, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes other familiar plants like ivy and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
